spell.name: Aegis of Shadows
entries: A protective aura of shadows forms around you, and stays with you until the spell ends. You gain {@dice 5d6} temporary hit points. While you have these temporary hit points and the spell is active, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the amount of temporary hit points is increased by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Age Creature

m.text: a pinch of powdered ruby worth at least 10gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell {@table Aging Effects|farover|ages} the targeted creature by up to 12 years. Unwilling creatures are allowed a Wisdom saving throw to resist the spell.

Subjects cannot be aged beyond their natural life spans. If the spell would cause a creature would be aged beyond this age, the creature is aged to one year short of their maximum age. The spell cannot cause a subject to die. Humanoid creatures affected by the spell experience changes in appearance associated with increased age, such as gray hair and wrinkles. More significantly, they may suffer the negative effects of {@table Aging Effects|farover|aging} in stats, which are optional rules depending on your DM.

Nonmagical monsters can be affected by age creature. The DM determines a monster's current age and natural life span based on the DM's own judgment or information. An aged monster abides by the same stages of aging as humanoid creatures, and thus suffers the same changes to stats.

The reverse of this spell, restore youth, permanently restores age that has been lost as a result of magic (such as an age creature spell). Restore youth reduces the age of the targeted creature by up to 12 years. Subjects who's youth is restored regain any lost ability scores. A subject cannot become younger than their actual age as a result of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the amount of years the spell ages or restores youth is increased by 4 for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Crushing Walls

components.m: a 1-inch iron cube and a walnut shell

entries: This spell enables the caster to enchant a floor, ceiling, or single wall of a room to crush intruders. The enchanted surface can be no larger than a 30' x 30' surface. The spell activates {@dice 1d4} rounds after any creature other than the caster enters the room. The intruder must be larger than a normal rat (larger than one-half cubic foot or weighing more than three pounds). When activated, the enchanted surface moves toward the opposite surface at a rate of 5 feet per round. Unless the spell is canceled by the caster using an action, the enchanted surface continues to move until one of the following events occurs:

A creature with sufficient Strength (minimum score of 20) stops the enchanted surface from moving by succeeding on a Strength check contested by the casters spell save DC. Such a creature suffers no damage from the enchanted surface. If the creature prevents the enchanted surface from moving for three consecutive rounds, the wall returns to its original position and the spell is negated. If multiple creatures attempt to stop the wall, the Strength check is rolled at advantage, the highest strength score is used as a base score, and one point is added to that score for every creature assisting. Thus, a creature with 17 Strength assisted by three creatures could attempt to stop the wall.

A strong or heavy object made of stone, wood, or metal is placed in the path of the wall. If the item survives {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage, the object successfully braces the wall (Use appropriate object hit points as explained in the "Statistics for Objects" section of the DMG). If the object holds for three consecutive rounds, the surface returns to its original position and the spell is negated. The DM must use discretion in determining the types of objects that will brace the wall.
Dispel magic or a similar spell or magical item is used to cancel the crushing wall.

The crushing wall almost never touches the opposite wall, usually being stopped by debris. A gap of two inches or more usually remains between the walls. If the wall is not stopped, it causes crushing damage to everyone in the room. All affected creatures must make a Constitution saving throw. Those who fail suffer {@damage 16d10} bludgeoning damage, and those who pass suffer half. When the wall can move no farther, it returns to its original position and the spell ends.

spell.name: Disbelief
entries: This spell allows the caster to temporarily convince themself that certain objects within the area of effect, or as many as four creatures within range do not actually exist. While disbelief remains in effect, these objects or creatures cannot harm or hinder the caster. The caster can pass through them as if they did not exist and takes no damage from their attacks or actions. However, since these objects or creatures temporarily do not exist for the caster, the caster can take no actions against them, or harm them in any way.

The caster can attempt to disbelieve as many as four creatures within 60 feet of their position at the time of casting. Alternatively, the caster can disbelieve any or all inanimate objects in a 30 foot cube. This cube must be centered on a point no more than 60 feet from the caster. These two options are mutually exclusive; the priest can disbelieve only creatures or objects, not a combination of both.

Disbelieving a creature includes all gear, equipment, or treasure carried or worn by that creature; it does not include other objects that come into contact with that creature, such as walls, doors, chairs, etc.

Disbelief is not automatic; it requires an extreme effort. To successfully disbelieve, the caster must fail an Intelligence saving throw contested by the casters own spell save DC. A failed save means the caster has disbelieved; a successful save means that the spell has failed and the caster has not convinced themself of the creatures' or objects' non-existence.

While this spell is in effect, the DM or player must record any damage suffered by the caster from disbelieved creatures. When the spell ends, the caster must make a Wisdom saving throw contested by the casters own spell save DC. If the saving throw is successful, the caster suffers only one-fourth of any damage inflicted by the creatures during the spell. If the caster fails the saving throw, they suffer half of any damage inflicted.
{@italic Concentration Points: 4}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the amount of creatures the caster can disbelieve is increased by one for each level above 6th, and the size of the cube for disbelieved objects is increased by 10 feet for each level above 6th.

spell.name: Entropy Shield

m.text: a gemstone worth at least 100

entries: This potent defense spell surrounds the caster in a chaotic maelstrom of energy and demimatter that blocks or deflects many attacks. The entropy shield extends to 5 feet in all directions from the caster's body. The warping effect of the field causes all melee attacks within it against the caster to be made at disadvantage. In addition, non-magical missiles or hurled weapons targeted at the caster miss automatically as the entropy shield deflects them. Magical missile attacks are made at disadvantage.

Even spells can be deflected. Against spells or effects that produce energy, gas, or other physical attack forms (fireball, lightning bolt, cloudkill, and other such spells) the entropy shield provides a chance that the attack simply does not affect the protected caster. If you are subjected to this kind of spell and it allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw.

Any spell or effect that does not create matter or energy to harm or hinder the victim can pass through the entropy shield normally, so mind-based attacks and magical effects such as petrification, paralyzation, enfeeblement, or polymorph (to name a few) can still affect the caster.
{@italic Concentration Points: 4}

spell.name: Fool's Speech

components.m: a small whistle made of bone

entries: With this spell, the wizard empowers themself and others of their choosing with the ability to speak a secret language incomprehensible to others. Creatures designated to speak the language must be touching each other when the spell is cast.
Once cast, the characters can choose to speak normally or in their secret tongue. They can speak and understand this mysterious language fluently.

Fool's speech is not recognizable as any known languages, nor does it remotely sound like any language, but is it comprehendable by someone under the effects of a spell such as {@spell Tongues|farover}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level, the duration becomes 8 hours. At 6th level, the duration becomes 24 hours, and at 8th level it becomes 3 days. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher makes the language of the spell incomprehensible to any other spell that divines languages, such as Tongues or Comprehend Languages.

spell.name: Force Grip
entries: By employing a form of telekinesis, you reach out with your hand in a grip-like gesture and attempt to strangle a creature within range that is no larger than one size larger than you. Creatures that do not need to breathe oxygen are unaffected.
The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition incapacitated}, its speed becomes 0, and it begins suffocating, as per the suffocating rules.

As long as the spell remains active, the target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a successful save. For the spell to remain active, you must maintain concentration and keep one free hand employed in the strangulation the entire time. Each time the target fails the saving throw at the end of its turn counts the end of one round towards the amount of time it can hold its breath while suffocating.
{@italic Concentration Points: 4}

spell.name: Irritation

components.m: a leaf from poison ivy, oak, or sumac

entries: An irritation spell affects the epidermis of a targeted creature. Creatures with no visible skin or a hide which is very thick (such as buffalo, elephants, scaled creatures, etc.) are not affected.

Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target begins to feel an itching sensation on a portion of its body at which the spell was cast. On each of the creatures turns thereafter, it must use either its action or all of its movement to scratch vehemently at the itch, which causes a stacking -2 penalty to the targets AC. If for any reason the target is unable to scratch the itch (such as being bound in rope), the target does not suffer the penalty to its AC, but simply does nothing on its turn and spends it writhing in irritation.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends, and the targets AC is restored to normal.
{@italic Concentration Points: 2}

spell.name: Legal Thoughts
entries: A cleric casting this spell forces the victim of the spell to follow one specific law. The cleric may choose any legitimate law prevalent in the area in which the cleric and the victim currently reside. Thus, if a city has no laws about murder, the cleric cannot command the target not to kill.

The victim of the spell is forced to obey the letter of the law to the best of its ability. Thus, if a victim were commanded not to commit murder, the victim would go to any length to avoid murdering someone. Since the essence of this spell is tied to legal (and not moral) interpretation, characters may find loopholes that will allow them to work around the law in specific cases or to ignore the law in light of extenuating circumstances.

When casting the spell, the cleric must speak the law to the recipient in such a way that they can hear it. The victim is allowed a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. If the save is failed, the victim will never willingly violate the stated law as long as the spell is in effect.
Legal thoughts can be negated by dispel magic. The victim of this spell never perceives anything wrong with adhering to the law, and therefore never seeks to have the spell removed.

spell.name: Malignant Missile

components.m: a soul shard, which the spell consumes

entries: When you cast this spell, you begin launching consecutive dark missiles of necrotic energy at a target within range. The magic of the spell keeps shooting missiles for as long as they keep hitting the target.

The missiles deal {@dice 3d4} necrotic damage. The first missile you launch hits the target automatically. For the second missile, make a ranged spell attack. For the third missile and all subsequent ones after that, make a ranged spell attack at disadvantage. You can keep making spell attacks until you miss, after which the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell as a Warlock with access to higher level spells than 2nd level, the damage of the missiles is increased by 1d4 for each spell level above 2nd.

spell.name: Minor Barrier
entries: You quickly wave your extended hand in the air in front of you, creating a small magical barrier. Until the beginning of your next turn, the first time you are hit with a ranged or melee weapon attack, the damage is reduced by {@dice 1d8}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of damage reduced by the spell is increased by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Murdock's Feathery Flyer
entries: Upon casting this spell, a feathery membrane grows under the wizards arms, extending along their sides all the way to the feet. The membrane appears to merge with the caster's skin and clothing.

Once cast, the spell must be activated on the same round by jumping from elevation, or it ends. For the duration of the spell, the caster can glide through the air with a movement speed of 50 after jumping from a point of elevation. For each foot of elevation, the caster can glide five feet horizontally. While gliding, the caster can not make weapon attacks or perform somatic components for spells.

While gliding, the caster must continuously keep gliding, which means the caster must use all of their remaining movement speed on their turn to glide. For every 5 feet of movement left un-glided, the caster then falls that amount of feet towards the ground at the end of the turn. Once the caster has landed on the ground for the first time after activating the spell, the spell ends.
If the caster of the spell attempts to glide while encumbered, they plummet towards the earth upon takeoff.
{@italic Concentration Points: 1}

spell.name: Physical Mirror
entries: This spell causes a localized folding of space. The folded space takes the form of an {@condition invisible} disk up to 10 feet in radius. Any missile weapon or spell that intersects with this disk is instantaneously reversed in direction. Factors such as speed, range, and damage are unaffected; the direction of the object or force is simply rotated through a 180 degree arc. The sender of the spell or missile finds themself the target of their own attack.

The physical mirror operates from only one direction; that is, only one side of the mirror reflects attacks. The caster of the mirror may direct spells and missile attacks normally through the space occupied by the mirror. In the case of physical attacks, the attacker must roll to hit themself. Spells turned back may require the caster to make a saving throw vs. their own spell. In both of these cases, range is important, because the range of the reflected attack is calculated from the attacker to the mirror and back to the attacker again. If the attack has insufficient range to travel this distance, then the attacker is safe.
When you cast the spell, you must specify the location and orientation of the physical mirror disk. Once it is created, the disk cannot be moved.

If two physical mirror disks touch or intersect, they destructively interact and both immediately vanish. The resulting "ripples" in the space-time continuum are exceedingly destructive and inflict {@damage 5d10} force damage to any creature within 120 feet, with a Dexterity saving throw for half damage.
{@italic Concentration Points: 3}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the duration of the spell is increased to Concentration, up to 10 minutes (3 points). If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, the duration of the spell becomes 10 minutes. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration of the spell becomes 1 hour.

spell.name: Skip Day
entries: When this spell is cast, all creatures with an Intelligence score of at least 5 within 10 feet of the caster are instantly transported 24 hours into the future. Creatures outside the area of effect will believe that the affected characters have simply disappeared. Unwilling creatures can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effect of skip day.

No time passes for creatures affected by skip day; they are in the exact condition that they were in before the spell was cast. They are similarly fatigued, have recovered no hit points, and carry the same spells.

The affected creatures remain in the same location as they were before skip day was cast. Their immediate environment is likely to have changed; for instance, fires have burned out, enemies who were attacking have departed, and weather has changed for better or worse.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, the amount of time skipped is increased to 48 hours.

spell.name: Spectral Hand
entries: This spell causes a glowing hand to materialize within range, and move and act as the caster desires. When casting the spell, the caster can have an item as an optional material component for the spell, which causes it to teleport into the conjured hand when the spell is cast. You can dismiss the hand as an action. If the hand is ever more than 60 feet away from you, it vanishes.

While the spell remains active, the caster can use a bonus action on their turn to cause the hand to either move up to 30 feet, execute an action similar to the {@spell Mage Hand} cantrip, attack either unarmed or with an equipped weapon, or throw an object it is capable of carrying up to 30 feet. The hand uses the casters proficiencies and stats for attacks, and it can only hold weapons and objects that weigh up to 10 pounds and can be held in one hand.

In addition, any spell with a range of touch of 3rd level or lower that is subsequently cast by the wizard can be delivered by the spectral hand as long as the hand is within 5 feet of the target and is not holding anything.
{@italic Concentration Points: 1}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the level of touch spells the hand can deliver is increased by one for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Weather Invocation
entries: By means of the weather invocation spell, the druid harnesses the natural potency of the current form of weather presiding in the area. Depending on the current weather, the spell takes on different forms as explained below, but if non of the mentioned weather phenomena are present, the spell has no effect. If multiple weather phenomena are present, the caster can choose which one to invoke.

Sunny. If the current weather is a mostly clear sky with sun, the caster can draw in solar energy with an action. After doing so, the caster must concentrate on weather invocation for one round (3 points). If the caster concentrates on the spell until their next turn, the caster can then unleash a devastating solar beam as an action in a 60 foot long and 10 foot wide line. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Rain/Snow. If the current weather is raining or snowing, the caster can cause the amount of precipitation to massively increase and pelt foes. Each creature of the casters choice that they can see within 120 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d6} cold damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

Fog. If the current weather is foggy, the caster can cause the prevalent moisture in the air to thicken and prevent movement and vision. Each creature of the casters choice that the caster can see within 120 feet must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they are {@condition blinded} and their movement speed is halved until the end of their next turn.

Thunderstorm. If the current weather is a thunderstorm, the caster can call down electricity in the air into a single, potent bolt of lightning at an area. Each creature within 120 feet in a cylinder that is 300 feet tall and has a 10-foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. A bolt of lightning strikes that location, dealing {@damage 5d12} lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one.

spell.name: Summon Creature

m.text: a bone, tooth or other remains of the type of creature to be summoned, which the spell consumes

entries: The caster speaks the words to the spell while holding the remains of the creature in their primary hand. The remains burst into flame, which the caster then reaches through to pull out an individual of that type who is then bound to the caster's will. Casters cannot summon specific individuals with this spell, and mindless/soulless creatures cannot be bound (oozes, undead, etc.). This spell does not bring any weapons, armor, or equipment that the creature wasn't already wearing.

The caster must physically touch the creature when it pulls it through the flame, but the creature does not appear held in the caster's hand. Instead it appears wherever desired within 10 feet of the caster.

Creatures that cannot understand the caster will simply attack whoever the caster indicates at the time of the summon and cannot be called off once sent to attack. Creatures that can understand the caster will obey verbal commands to the best of their ability, but will not be self destructive. A goblin might be ordered to charge a dragon, but it will not throw itself off a cliff.

The creature, upon being summoned, will make a check to burst the casters dominance on them. By default, the creature rolls a {@dice d100}, and the caster rolls a contested ability check based on their spellcasting ability. If the CR of the creature being summoned is less than the level of the caster, the die size the creature rolls for the check decreases by 20 for every whole CR the creature is lower. The lowest die a creature can roll for the check is a {@dice d10}, at 5 CR or more below. If the creature meets or beats the caster, the creature is freed.

If the creature successfully bursts the spell, it becomes free willed and remains at the location until the one hour spell duration is up, after which it is un-summoned. In this case the creature usually becomes very angry at the summoner, who it will probably try to destroy.
Once either the 1 hour spell duration ends, the casters concentration is broken, or if the caster uses a bonus action during the spell, the summoned creature is un-summoned, ending the spell.
{@italic Concentration Points: 3}

spell.name: Enchant Item

m.text: the item(s) being enchanted and 200 gold, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell can either enchant a non-magical item into a magical item of common quality, or move an enchantment from one magical item of uncommon or lower quality into a non-magical item.

{@bold {@italic Creating a magical item from a non-magical item.}} The item being created can be an item in an official sourcebook, or a custom one of similar strength/usefulness, but either way the enchantment is done at the DM's discretion.

{@bold {@italic Moving an enchantment to a non-magical item.}} The item being created can be one with the same enchantment as the original item (for example moving a +1 enchantment from a longsword to a greataxe), or it can change to a different enchantment of similar strength when moving it (for example making {@item Goggles of Night} out of a {@item Cloak of the Manta Ray}), but either way the enchantment is done at the DM's discretion.

spell.name: Ice Block

time.condition: which you take when you are hit with a damaging attack

entries: You immediately encase yourself in a large block of ice, blocking any incoming damage that isn't psychic damage. You remain in this block of ice until the end of your next turn, when the ice melts away. While in this state, you are {@condition incapacitated} and {@condition restrained}, but you are also immune to all damage and effects, with the exception of psychic damage. Spells and effects that only rely on vision or hearing will still affect you.

spell.name: Identify Curse
entries: This spell can identify the potency and properties of any curse afflicting a creature or item.

spell.name: Rune of Power
entries: You draw a magical rune of power on the ground under you with an area of one square, occupying enough space for one creature of size Medium or smaller. When standing inside the rune and while maintaining concentration, all damaging spells you cast are automatically cast at one spell level higher.
{@italic Concentration Points: 1}

spell.name: Random Causality
entries: This spell creates a rift in the nature of cause and effect. The target of the spell must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell is cast upon an opponent's weapon. When the weapon is used, it hits and causes damage normally, but the damage is not applied to the creature struck by the weapon. Instead, the person wielding the weapon or one of his companions suffers the damage. When this effect happens, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a successful one. If the weapon misses its target on any round, no damage is caused in that round.

Using a die roll, the DM randomly determines the victim of the damage. The DM selects a die with a value nearest the number of eligible creatures (the wielder of the weapon and his companions). If the number of creatures does not equate to highest value of a die, the wielder of the enchanted weapon takes the extra chances to be hit. For example, if a goblin wields a sword affected by this spell, he and his six companions are eligible to receive the damage. The DM rolls {@dice 1d8}. On a roll of 1-6, one of the goblin's companions suffers the damage; on a roll of 7 or 8, the goblin with the affected weapon suffers the damage.
If the wielder of the weapon changes weapons while the spell is in effect, the discarded weapon remains enchanted.
{@italic Concentration Points: 3}

spell.name: Miscast Magic
entries: Miscast magic can be cast on any spellcaster. The target spellcaster must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, it causes the spells cast by the affected spellcaster to be chosen randomly from their prepared spells of the same or lower level. Thus, if a spellcaster affected by miscast magic had four 1st-level spells prepared ({@spell mage armor}, {@spell feather fall}, {@spell jump|farover}, and {@spell magic missile}) and they attempted to cast the {@spell magic missile} spell, the DM would determine the resulting spell randomly from the spellcasters four prepared spells. The spellcaster would only have a 25% chance of casting the {@spell magic missile} spell. Only spells currently prepared are eligible to be exchanged with the desired spell. If a spellcaster had only one spell prepared, the miscast magic would have no effect and the spellcasters spell would be cast normally. If the spell is cast on a spellcaster that doesn't prepare spells, the spell is chosen from amongst all the spells that the spellcaster currently could cast.

The miscast spell operates normally. If a spellcaster tried to {@spell feather fall} a companion but a {@spell web} spell resulted, the companion would be targeted by the webs and subject to all resulting effects. If the target of the spell were in range of the {@spell feather fall} spell but not in range of the web, the spell would be lost in a fizzle of energy. If a spell such as {@spell sending} was the intended spell to be cast on a target hundreds of miles away, the {@spell sending} spell would be lost in a fizzle of energy, unless the random result spell would have an equal or greater range and could be cast on a target in the same way {@spell sending} could.

The spellcaster who casts the spell performs the proper components of the spell they wish to cast, but they do not discover the altered results until the wrong spell takes effect. The spellcaster will also discover that, if either the intended spell or the resulting spell required consumable material components, they will both be consumed. Once an affected spellcaster casts a random spell, they can repeat the Wisdom saving throw to attempt to end the effect.
{@italic Concentration Points: 3}

spell.name: Enchant Greater Item

m.text: the item(s) being enchanted and 1000 gold, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell can either enchant a non-magical item into a magical item of uncommon quality, or move an enchantment from one magical item of rare or lower quality into a non-magical item.

{@bold {@italic Creating a magical item from a non-magical item.}} The item being created can be an item in an official sourcebook, or a custom one of similar strength/usefulness, but either way the enchantment is done at the DM's discretion.

{@bold {@italic Moving an enchantment to a non-magical item.}} The item being created can be one with the same enchantment as the original item (for example moving a +2 enchantment from a longsword to a greataxe), or it can change to a different enchantment of similar strength when moving it (for example making an {@item Amulet of Health} out of a pair of {@item Boots of Speed}), but either way the enchantment is done at the DM's discretion.

spell.name: Malakai's Teleportation Circle
entries: This spell has two uses; the first to construct a magical teleportation circle for the purposes of the spell and the second to activate a teleportation circle and teleport the contents of one circle to another and vice-versa.

In order to construct a circle the caster must carve out an intricate circle of at least 5 feet in diameter, this takes 1 day for every 20 feet circumference of the circle. Then chunks of silver, costing 100gp per 1 foot diameter of the circle, must be placed at points along the circle. Upon completion of casting the spell the silver melts to form the in-laid silver circle. A 5 foot diameter circle can fit one Medium creature in it, a 10 foot circle two, and a 15 foot circle four. When casting the spell in this way the wizard must designate a keyword to act as this circles name.

The second use of the spell allows the contents of the current circle to switch with the contents of any of the other circles for which the caster knows the keyword. If a circle is broken by anything at the time of casting the contents of that circle are teleported to a random location. It is imperative the caster ensures his circle is unbroken before casting.
If more than one magic circle has the same keyword then there is an equal chance of switching with either even if they were created by different casters.

spell.name: Battlefate
entries: This spell alters probability to favor one character or creature locked in battle. The spell provides a combat benefit for the duration of the spell, which is a +2 to the affected stat. When the spell is cast on a target, roll a {@dice 1d4}. The result of the die indicates the resulting combat benefit as follows:
Bonus to AC
Bonus to Saving throws
Bonus to {@action Attack} rolls
Bonus to Damage rolls
For the duration of the spell, you can reroll the {@dice 1d4} on your turn as a bonus action to attempt to change the combat benefit to another.
{@italic Concentration Points: 1}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus is a +3. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bonus is a +4. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the bonus is a +5. If you use a spell slot of 9th level, the bonus is a +6.

spell.name: Blessed Watchfulness
entries: By casting this spell, the caster confers exceptional powers of observation and alertness to one creature for the duration of the spell. While blessed watchfulness is in effect, the designated sentinel remains alert, awake and vigilant for the 8 hour duration of the spell. For the duration of the spell, the target cannot fall asleep, and it does not need to sleep.

The target creature also gains advantage to saving throws against the first time they are affected by any spell or effect that would lower their guard or force them to abandon their watch, including charm, fear, or similar mind-affecting spells.

Once the spell is cast, the day and night cycle the target was on is also delayed by one day, meaning the target delays the need or want for sleep until the time at which it would sleep on the day after.
A creature can not benefit from Blessed Watchfulness again until it has finished at least one nights rest.

spell.name: Endure Cold/Heat
entries: The creature receiving this spell is protected from normal extremes of cold or heat (depending on which application the priest selects at the time of casting). The creature can stand unprotected in temperatures as low as -30 C°, or as high as 50 C° (depending on application) with no ill effect. Temperatures beyond these limits inflict 1 point of damage per hour of exposure for every degree beyond the limit. The spell is immediately cancelled if the recipient is affected by any non-normal heat or cold, such as magic, breath weapons, and so on. The cancellation occurs regardless of the application and regardless of whether a heat or cold effect hits the character (for example, an endure cold spell is cancelled by magical heat or fire as well as by magical cold).
The recipient of the spell does not suffer the first 10 points of damage (before any applicable saving throws) from the heat or cold during the round in which the spell is broken.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, the amount of damage mitigated is increased by 5 points, and the duration of the spell is increased by 4 hours for each slot above 1st.

spell.name: Tasha's Mind Whip
entries: You psychically lash out at one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage, and it can't take a reaction until the end of its next turn. Moreover, on its next turn, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spell's other effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Tasha's Otherworldly Guise

m.text: an object engraved with a symbol of the Outer Planes, worth at least 500 gp

entries: Uttering an incantation, you draw on the magic of the Lower Planes or Upper Planes (your choice) to transform yourself. You gain the following benefits until the spell ends:

items: You are immune to fire and poison damage (Lower Planes) or radiant and necrotic damage (Upper Planes).
You are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition (Lower Planes) or the {@condition charmed} condition (Upper Planes).
Spectral wings appear on your back, giving you a flying speed of 40 feet.
You have a +2 bonus to AC.
All your weapon attacks are magical, and when you make a weapon attack, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that lets you attack more than once when you take the Attack action on your turn.

entries: {@italic Concentration Points: 4}

spell.name: Know Age/Time
entries: This spell enables the caster to know one of two things. The caster can instantly know the age of any single person, creature, or object on which they concentrate within range, to the nearest year. Alternatively, the caster can instantly know the precise time of day to the nearest minute, including the current hour, day, month, and year.

spell.name: Sacred Guardian

components.m: a rose petal that has been kissed by the spell recipient

entries: By use of this spell, a cleric becomes instantly aware when the recipient of the spell is in danger, regardless of the distance between the priest and the recipient. The recipient may be on a different plane of existence than the cleric. When this spell is cast by a cleric of at least 3rd level, they receive a mental image of the endangered person's situation. At no time, however, does the cleric know the person's location through the use of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, the spell lasts 1 day longer for each slot above 1st.

spell.name: Thought Capture
entries: This spell makes the clerics brain something of a magnet that attracts thought objects in close proximity. The cleric can sense strong thoughts and emotions and can sometimes even see momentary visions of creatures who died or suffered some powerful emotion in the immediate vicinity. Thought objects are always attracted to the cleric in the order of the strongest (those attached to powerful emotions or significant events) to the weakest.

Thus, if several thought objects share the same vicinity, the cleric will perceive information about the most interesting or significant event. The cleric might pick up images of a battle from the point of view of a warrior who died there, or he might gain information about the victor of the battle.

The DM dictates the information provided to the cleric, and thus can use this spell to provide players with important background information or can add texture to a campaign world. The information provided might be highly cryptic or symbolic, perhaps in the form of a rhyme or riddle.

The cleric gains one thought object per casting of the spell. The spell may be cast a number of times in the same locale, with the cleric gaining a different thought object with each casting. A locale contains a finite number of thoughts, however, and once the cleric has gained all of them (per the DM), the spell will fail in that locale.

spell.name: Chant
entries: By means of the chant spell, the cleric brings special favor upon themself and their party, and causes harm to their enemies. When the Chant spell is active, all attack rolls and saving throws made by those in the area of effect who are friendly to the cleric gain a {@dice d4} bonus, while those of the clerics enemies suffer a {@dice d4} penalty.

This bonus/penalty continues as long as the caster continues to chant the mystic syllables. This means that while chanting, the cleric must spend time continuing the chant each turn, meaning the cleric can only use either an action or a bonus action, but not both.
A {@spell Silence} spell, or any effect that would even momentarily restrict the clerics voice from being heard also ends the spell.
{@italic Concentration Points: 2}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius of the spell is increased by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hesitation

components.m: a fragment of a turtle's shell

entries: Creatures affected by this spell hesitate before executing their intended actions. Each creature of the casters choice in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell causes them to modify their next initiative roll by -10, and on a successful save by -5. The initiative modifier occurs in the round following the round in which Hesitation is cast.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initiative modifier is reduced by an additional -2 on a failed save, and -1 on a successful save for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Guarding Haze
entries: The cleric conjures an insubstantial haze brought forth by the spells casting at a point within range. The spell creates a thin haze at the edges of a 20-foot radius centered on that point. Any creature not indicated by the cleric at the time of the spells casting that comes into contact with the haze is affected by the spell. Any creature entering the guarded area must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

A successful saving throw indicates that the subject creature was unaffected by the haze, and the spell remains in place. As soon as a subject creature is successfully {@condition paralyzed} by the haze, the paralysis takes effect and the spell dissipates. The spell also dissipates if no intruder is struck by the haze for 8 hours after the spell is cast.

Any creature approaching the area affected by the haze may be able to detect its presence with a successful {@skill Perception} check against your spell save DC, before coming close enough to be affected.

spell.name: Withdraw
entries: By means of a withdraw spell, the cleric in effect alters the flow of time with regard to themself. While but one round of time passes for those not affected by the spell when it is cast, the cleric is able to spend two additional rounds on the turn the cleric casts Withdraw, in contemplation.

Although the cleric is only able to spend two rounds during the spell, time flows much slower for the cleric during Withdraw, allowing the player one minute of real time per round withdrawn to ponder some problem or question. No discussion with other players is permitted.

While affected by the Withdraw spell, the caster can use only the following spells: any divination spell or any curing or healing spell, the latter on the cleric themself only. The casting of any of these spells in a different fashion (for example, a {@spell Cure Wounds} spell bestowed upon a companion) fails. Similarly, the withdrawn caster cannot move, become {@condition invisible}, or engage in actions other than thinking, reading, and the like.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the amount of additional rounds afforded to you is increased by one for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Accelerate Healing
entries: This spell enables the affected creature to experience improved natural healing. A character who has this spell cast on them by a cleric regains twice the amount of hit points from their expended hit dice for {@dice 2d4} days.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level, the duration of the spell is increased to {@dice 3d4} days. At 7th level, this becomes {@dice 4d4}, and at 9th level {@dice 5d4}.

spell.name: Continual Light

m.text: gold dust worth 80 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell is similar to the Light spell, except that it lasts until it is dispelled. The spell causes the targeted point, object, or creature to shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The light is as bright as daylight, and cancels even magical darkness in its area. Completely covering the source of the light with something opaque blocks the light. The spell blinds a creature if it is successfully cast upon the creature's visual organs. Continual Light can can be cast in two different ways:

You can cast the spell at a point, object, or creature you can see within 60 feet. If you target a hostile creature, or an object worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell. You can also cast the spell more precisely with a range of touch, allowing you to target a specific part of a creature.

spell.name: Phase Shift
entries: With this spell, the caster shifts their body slightly on to the ethereal plane for the duration of the spell. While in this state, most of the casters body physically remains on the material plane, but on the material plane the caster is seen as an ethereal form of themself.

During this time, the caster can see both the material and ethereal planes, and can interact with both planes as well. The caster also takes 3 reduced damage from all sources, can not be perceived by divination spells, and can move through solid objects on the material plane by spending 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot moved.

When either the spell or the casters turn while the spell is active ends, and the caster occupies the same spot as a solid object or creature, they are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that they can occupy and suffer force damage equal to twice the number of feet they are moved.
{@italic Concentration Points: 2}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level, the duration of the spell is increased to 10 minutes. At 5th level, this becomes 1 hour, at 6th level 8 hours, at 7th level 1 day, and at 9th level 7 days.

spell.name: Enchant Supreme Item

m.text: the item(s) being enchanted and 3250 gold, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell can either enchant a non-magical item into a magical item of rare quality, or move an enchantment from one magical item of very rare or lower quality into a non-magical item.

{@bold {@italic Creating a magical item from a non-magical item.}} The item being created can be an item in an official sourcebook, or a custom one of similar strength/usefulness, but either way the enchantment is done at the DM's discretion.

{@bold {@italic Moving an enchantment to a non-magical item.}} The item being created can be one with the same enchantment as the original item (for example moving a +3 enchantment from a longsword to a greataxe), or it can change to a different enchantment of similar strength when moving it (for example making an {@item Animated Shield} out of a {@item Carpet of Flying}), but either way the enchantment is done at the DM's discretion.

spell.name: Memory Read

components.m: a small piece of linen cloth

entries: This spell allows the caster to read the memory of a single subject. The caster experiences the memory with the same intensity as the subject. The time required to view a memory is 1/50 of the time that the actual event lasted. Thus, the caster can view the memory of an event that lasted for 5 minutes in roughly one round. When cast at 3rd level, the spell allows the caster to view a memory lasting up to 5 minutes in length, or one round in real time. The subject experiences the memory at the same time the caster reads it.

The subject must have an Intelligence score of 5 or more and must remain within range of the caster throughout the time it takes to read the desired memory. Casters can cast this spell on {@condition unconscious}, sleeping, held, or {@condition paralyzed} creatures. The subject receives a Wisdom saving throw when the caster casts the spell (this saving throw is allowed even if the subject is asleep or otherwise unaware of the attempt). The target has advantage on the saving throw if it is engaged in combat with the caster or its allies.

In addition, if the memory that the caster wants to view concerns something the subject wants to keep secret, or is something that the subject is trying to suppress, the subject receives a +5 bonus to the saving throw. If the memory the caster wishes to view is more than six months old, the subject receives a second saving throw, with bonuses depending on the age of the memory as follows:

entries.name: Age of Memory Bonus
entries: 1 to 4 years +2, 5 years or more +5. If the subject succeeds either of these saving throws, the spell fails.

This spell creates a mental drain on the caster, causing them to temporarily have their hit point maximum lowered by {@dice 3d4} hit points, increasing by {@dice 1d4} for every spell slot level above 3rd. This cumulative reduction lasts until the caster completes a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the length of the memory viewed can be up to 30 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the length can be up to 1 hour. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the length can be up to 3 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the length can be up to 8 hours.

spell.name: Rigid Thinking
entries: Rigid Thinking can be cast only upon a creature with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher. The target creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or be subjected to the following effect.

A creature affected by Rigid Thinking is incapable of performing any action other than the activity they are involved in when the spell takes effect. The creature's mind simply cannot decide on another course of action--it becomes frozen into a single thought and cannot change even if new circumstances would suggest otherwise. Thus, a fighter fighting a kobold will ignore the arrival of a beholder, and a rogue picking a lock will pay no heed to the arrival of three guards.
An affected creature will not continue to fire their bow at a dragon if they run out of arrows, but will choose another means of attacking the dragon to the exclusion of all other activities.

A spellcaster in the process of casting a spell when Rigid Thinking takes effect will attempt to repeat the spell at the same target if possible, and if they don't have the resources to do so, they will then attempt to continue working towards their goal with other appropriate means.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns to end the spell. Otherwise, the spell expires when the target accomplishes their goal (i.e., the kobold is killed or the lock is opened) or when the spells duration ends.
{@italic Concentration Points: 3}

spell.name: Lesser Telepathy

components.m: a small book with numerological markings

entries: You create a telepathic link between yourself and a creature within range with an Intelligence score of at least 5. If the creature is unwilling, it can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effect.

Until the spell ends, you and the target can can communicate silently and rapidly. Telepathy does not give either participant access to the other's thoughts, memories, or emotions. Participants can only "hear" the thoughts that the other participant actively "sends." Mind-to-mind communication is approximately four times faster than verbal communication. The level of complexity that can be communicated is only that which can be expressed through language. Gestures, expressions, and body language cannot be conveyed.

spell.name: Strength of One
entries: When casting this spell, the caster imbues up to two creatures out of a group of three (unincluding the caster) with a temporary Strength score equal to that of the strongest creature in the group. The caster can also be the one whos Strength score is shared if it possesses the highest score, but can still only affect two creatures. To be affected by the spell, all creatures must touch the hand of the caster at the time of casting. Only humanoid creatures of size Medium or lower may be affected.

Upon completion of the spell, all affected characters gain a Strength score equal to the Strength score of the creature with the highest score in the group. Any magical bonuses affecting the creature who's Strength is shared are not added; only the the natural Strength is conferred on the group.
This bonus supercedes any magical or other bonus an affected character would gain from a different source.

The spell ends if either the Strength sharing creature or the caster are {@condition incapacitated} or killed before the duration expires. The bonus and duration are not affected if a different member of the group is {@condition incapacitated} or killed within the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of creatures that can benefit from the spell is increased by one for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Tree
entries: By means of this spell, the caster is able to assume the form of a small living tree or shrub or that of a large dead tree trunk with only a few limbs. Although the closest inspection cannot reveal that this plant is actually a person, and for all normal tests he is, in fact, a tree or shrub, the caster is able to observe all that goes on around them just as if they were in normal form. The Armor Class and hit points of the plant are those of the caster. The caster can remove the spell at any time as an action, instantly changing from plant to his normal form and having full capability for any action normally possible (including spellcasting). Note that all clothing and gear worn or carried change with the caster.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is up to 1 hour. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is up to 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration is up to 24 hours. If you use a 7th level spell slot, the duration is up to 1 week. If you use an 8th level spell slot, the duration is up to 1 month. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the duration is up to 1 year.

spell.name: Unfailing Premonition
entries: By anticipating possible futures and outcomes of the caster's actions, this spell provides the character with a temporary sixth sense or feel for danger. The spell operates on a subconscious level, and for 10 minutes after casting the spell, the caster receives strong intuitive impulses when they contemplate courses of action that may bring immediate physical injury or harm to them. In addition, the caster has advantage on Dexterity saving throws for the duration of the spell.
For example, if the cleric was about to open a trapped chest, the unfailing premonition would create a flash of insight or a gut feeling telling them that they shouldn't do so.

Similarly, opening a door that leads into the lair of a ferocious troll may also trigger the spell's warning. Threatening a NPC who is likely to respond by drawing a weapon and attacking the PC would create a warning, but threatening a NPC who will get even with the cleric in an hour or two will not trigger the premonition.
{@italic Concentration Points: 1}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration of the spell is increased by 10 minutes for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Weather Prediction
entries: By casting this spell, the caster can predict the weather conditions at the current location for the next 24 hours. The caster becomes aware of the prevailing conditions, trends, and weather systems that may affect the current location.

Temperature, wind speed, cloud cover, and precipitation can all be predicted with 95% accuracy for the next day. Magical or supernatural phenomena cannot be predicted. Casters of powers concerned with weather may use this spell to determine the best time for certain ceremonies or observances. Other casters can find weather prediction useful for planning journeys or selecting campsites.

spell.name: Control Temperature
entries: When this spell is cast, the temperature in the area surrounding the caster can be altered by 100 C°, either upward or downward. The spell can be used to ensure the comfort of the caster and those accompanying in extreme weather conditions. The party could stand about in shirt sleeves during the worst blizzard (although it would be raining on them) or make ice for their drinks during a scorching heat wave.

The spell also provides protection from intense normal and magical attacks. If the extreme of temperature is beyond what could be affected by the spell (a searing blast of a fireball or the icy chill of a white dragon), the spell reduces the damage caused by up to 40 points individually for every creature inside the area of the spell. Normal saving throws are still allowed, and the reduction is taken before the saving throw is made. Once struck by such an attack, the spell immediately ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the amount of damage points the spell can mitigate is increased by 5 for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Dimensional Anchor
entries: When you cast this spell, a green ray springs from your outstretched hand and it unerringly strikes a creature within line of sight and the range of the spell. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the spell covers the subject with a shimmering emerald field that tethers the subject to that physical location for the duration of the spell.

The spell has two effects. Firstly, it completely blocks bodily extradimensional travel. Forms of movement barred by the dimensional anchor include {@spell blink|phb|blinking}, {@spell dimension door}, {@spell etherealness}, {@spell gate}, {@spell misty step}, {@spell plane shift}, and any other similar teleportation or psionic abilities.

Secondly, the spell tethers the target to the location it is in. If by any means the target moves over 30 feet away from the location where it was subjected to the spell, it is then pulled back to that location by the green tethers of the spell at the end of the turn on which is moved. When this effect occurs, the target can repeat the Charisma saving throw, ending the spell on a successful save.
{@italic Concentration Points: 3}

spell.name: Inverted Ethics
entries: This spell reverses the ethics of a person or group of people. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw when you cast this spell or be affected by it.

While under the influence of this spell, a creature behaves in a manner opposite to the way they normally would behave. Thus, a shopkeeper influenced by inverted ethics will think it perfectly normal for someone to pick up an item from the shop and walk out the door without paying for it. If someone tried to pay for an item, the shopkeeper would be insulted. If the spell is cast on a shopper in a store, they would find it natural to steal the item, thinking that they are behaving in a proper way. If the spell is cast on a professed thief, they will no longer steal, choosing to pay for the goods instead.

Inverted ethics does not cause a creature to actively commit evil deeds (or good deeds). Thus, an affected creature will not go on a shoplifting rampage; it will steal only as the opportunity presents itself.

spell.name: Spell Immunity

m.text: emerald dust worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: By means of this spell, the cleric renders a creature touched immune to the effects of a specified spell of 4th level or lower for the duration. It can protect against spells, spell-like effects of magical items, and innate spellcasting abilities of creatures. It does not protect against breath weapons or gaze attacks of any type.

The spell has a few additional limitations. Firstly, the caster must have directly experienced the effect of the specified spell. For example, if the caster has been attacked by a fireball spell at some time, the caster can use the spell immunity spell to provide protection from a fireball. Secondly, only a particular spell can be protected against, not a certain school of spells or a group of spells that are similar in effect; thus, a creature given immunity to the lightning bolt spell is still vulnerable to a shocking grasp spell.

spell.name: Unfailing Endurance
entries: This spell, refered to by some as "magic meth", enhances the natural hardiness and stamina of the affected creatures by rendering them virtually immune to fatigue or {@condition exhaustion}, for a time. During the casting of the spell, the caster must touch each creature to be affected, and the spell can affect up to 5 creatures.

While under the spells influence, an affected creature does not need to sleep, nor do they suffer any negative effects from not sleeping. In addition, affected creatures can also force march for an additional amount of hours a day equal to their Constitution modifier, before they have to start rolling Constitution saving throws to prevent {@condition exhaustion}.

While the spell is in effect, affected creatures do not suffer the negative effects of {@condition exhaustion}, but they must keep track of the amount of {@condition exhaustion} they would accrue during that time otherwise. Once the spell ends, affected creatures immediately suffer half (rounded up) the amount of {@condition exhaustion} stacks that they would have accrued during the duration of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration of the spell is increased by 1 day for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Othertime

m.text: an hourglass filled with rare salts, worth at least 100 gp

entries: When a cleric enters Othertime, they step into a different reality in which the world around is frozen at a moment in the future. Until time catches up, the cleric may move about unhindered and observe their surroundings; no force known can detect their presence or harm them in the alternate reality, although they in turn cannot affect any creature or object in the physical world. To the clerics companions or enemies in real time, the cleric appears to simply vanish altogether, only to reappear at some later point.

The amount of time the cleric can travel into the future for is up to 1 minute. The duration chosen by the cleric governs the length of the Othertime; if the cleric decides that the spell will last 2 rounds, then they are instantly transported to that point in time, surrounded by the frozen still-life of the world as it will appear 2 rounds after the cleric cast Othertime. The caster then has 2 rounds to themself to take any actions, although they cannot affect the real world by any physical, magical, or mental means. While the caster is in the Othertime, they are completely unaware of the intervening events.

spell.name: Memory Wrack

m.text: a ruby worth at least 100 gp

entries: This spell "disconnects" the subject's short-term and long-term memory. When affected by this spell, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is incapable of storing information in long-term memory for the duration of the spell.

Every moment is virtually an independent event for the target; it can remember recent events, thoughts, and sensations for no more than one round. Memories of events that happened before the onset of the spell are not affected at all; these are safely stored in long-term memory.

While the spell is active, the subjected target is forced to concentrate, as if on a spell, to be able to act. Spellcasters already concentrating on a spell when Memory Wrack takes effect are forced to drop that spell, and they can not cast a concentration spell for the duration of Memory Wrack's effect.

If the target takes damage and is forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, on a failed save the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn, at which point they can repeat the Wisdom saving throw to attempt to end Memory Wrack.
When the spell ends, the target remembers nothing that happened while the spell was in effect.
{@italic Concentration Points: 4}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the spells duration remains the same, but no longer requires concentration.

spell.name: Shrieking Walls
entries: This spell enchants any single room no larger than the area of effect. When any creature larger than a normal rat (larger than one-half cubic foot or weighing more than three pounds) enters the room, shrill shrieks begin to emanate from the walls. The shrieks persist for {@dice 1d4 + 1} rounds. The walls do not undergo any physical change. The shrieks can be heard only by creatures inside the room. Creatures hearing the shrieks experience no ill effects on the first round, allowing them time to leave the room or cover their ears. Creatures who remain in the room during the second or subsequent rounds of the shrieks who have not protected their hearing are penalized as follows:

Creatures whose levels are greater than the level of the caster must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d6} rounds. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effects of the spell for 1 minute.

Creatures whose levels are less than or equal to the level of the caster become {@condition deafened} for {@dice 1d6} hours, and {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d6} rounds. Spellcasters {@condition deafened} by this effect have a 20% chance of miscasting any spell with a verbal component.
The effect of the spell persists for the duration of the spell no matter how many times the effect is triggered.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, the duration becomes 14 days. With a spell slot of 7th level, it becomes 1 month. With a spell slot of 8th level, it becomes 1 year, and with a spell slot of 9th level, the spell lasts until it is dispelled.

spell.name: Creeping Shadow

components.m: a small statuette of the caster sculpted from a piece of coal

entries: This spell causes the casters shadow to elongate, stretching away from their body at a rate of up to 30 feet per round, up to a maximum distance of 120 feet away. When creeping shadow is cast, and on each of the casters turns afterwards, the shadow stretches in a direction designated by the caster. The shadow can only travel on a physical surface, but it can move up walls and other structures and objects.

Creeping shadow can not be cast in darkness; at the very least dim light is required. The shadow itself makes no sound, and is generally difficult to spot. The shadow can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A small and medium sized caster creates a 5-foot wide shadow.

The shadow can not physically touch, pick up, or attack creatures or objects. The shadow can be attacked, but only by spells, magical effects, and magical weapons. The shadow has an AC equal to the caster, and if the shadow is damaged, the caster must make Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on the spell, even though no damage is applied.

While the spell is active, the caster can see, hear, and speak through the shadow. Wherever the shadow stretches, it creates difficult terrain for anyone standing in its area. At any point while the spell is active, the caster can use a bonus action to seep down into their shadow, and reappear at any point along the elongated shadow, teleporting to that location and rising up from the ground the shadow is covering in an unoccupied square. Teleporting in this way ends the spell.
{@italic Concentration Points: 2}

spell.name: Moderate Restoration

m.text: diamond dust worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature and mend them with a moderate amount of positive energy. You can grant the target one of the following effects:

items: Cure some form of lingering injury, as per the lingering injury table.
Reduce the target's {@condition exhaustion} level by three
Remove one effect causing a target to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}

spell.name: Permanency

m.text: platinum dust worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell affects the duration of certain other spells, making the duration permanent. The wizard casts the desired spell, and then follows it with the permanency spell. Permanency can not be cast on creatures, it can only be cast on items, objects, or areas no larger than 125 cubic feet which can be shaped in any way (an area can be as thin as 1 inch high, and 1500 feet long and wide). Permanency cast on items or objects only impart the magical effects to those touching, holding, or wearing the item or object, while permanency cast on areas affects everyone and everything in the area.

Permanency can only make certain spells permanent. Firstly, the spell being made permanent must have a duration of at least 1 minute. Secondly, the spell must be one that does not require a direct interaction between two or more creatures. Thirdly, the spell can not be one which normally ends once triggered or when a certain condition is met (excluding concentration). If a spell seems ambiguous when it comes to meeting these requirements, the DM has the final say on if it can be made permanent.

When cast at 5th level, only 1st level spells can be made permanent. Platinum dust is the material component for the spell, and the amount of platinum dust needed increases when the spell is cast at higher levels. The amount of gold needed in platinum dust equals that of {@variantrule spell scrolls|farover|10 times what is needed for a spell scroll of equal level}.

Permanency is vulnerable to anti-magic effects, and the {@spell dispel magic|farover} spell. When a dispel magic is cast on an object affected by permanency, the combined spell levels of the permanency spell and the spell made permanent are added to the DC, as is the spellcasters level at the time of the casting of permanency.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the level of spell that can be made permanent increases by one for each slot level above 5th. The material component cost increases as well, as explained in the spell description.

spell.name: Sending

m.text: {@item silver|phb} worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. If the creature is within 30 miles (50 km), it hears the message in its mind; otherwise, the spell fails. The target recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner within a few moments after receiving the message. A target of this spell can mentally block out an incoming message if it is unwilling to hear it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the amount of words that can be sent in the message is increased by 25, and the range of the spell is increased by 30 miles (50 km) for each slot level above 3rd, up to a maximum of 175 words and 210 miles (350 km) at 9th level.

spell.name: Burning Rush

time.condition: which you take in response to being damaged by a melee attack that you can see

entries: Fire streaks out of your feet for a moment, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily struck by flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
As part of the reaction, you can also move up to an amount equal to half your movement speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Drain Life
entries: You extend your hand, and attempt to draw the life energy from a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends. On a failed save, you begin siphoning life energy from the target, dealing damage and healing you. Roll {@dice 3d6}, and choose which of the dice heal you, and which of the dice deal necrotic damage to the target. You must both heal and deal damage with at least one die.

On each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to automatically repeat the effect on the target creature as long as you are within range and line of sight when doing so. If you do not spend an action continuing this spell every turn, it ends. The spell also ends if the target ever has total cover from you.
{@italic Concentration Points: 2}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount of dice rolled increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Death Coil
entries: A horrifying visage of dark energy is unleashed from your hand at a creature in range. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8+1d6} necrotic damage, and is forced to immediately use its reaction, if available, to flee as far as its speed allows in a direction indicated by the {@dice d8} (1 is up, and subsequent numbers go clockwise.) The creature can not move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit.
If a creature fails the save by 10 or more, you can decide the direction it moves in.
On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesn't have to move.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Soulburn
entries: You ignite the soul of a creature within range, and the combustion wreathes the target in flames. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also burns for the spell's duration.
At the end of each of its turns, the burning target must repeat the Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage on a failed save, and the effect ends on a successful one.

Any other creature that moves within 5 feet of a burning target or starts its turn there must also make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature also catches fire and is subjected to the spell's burn effect.
{@italic Concentration Points: 2}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6}, and the burn damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dark Bargain

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by a damaging attack

entries: A sinister shield of dark magic surrounds you when you are hit by an attack. When the shield appears, it has {@dice 2d6} hit points. Whenever you take damage, the shield takes the damage instead, and the shield has resistance to all damage. If damage reduces the shield to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage.
At the start of your next turn, the shield dissipates, and you immediately suffer the same damage the shield took earlier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the shields hit points increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Devouring Plague
entries: You attempt to afflict a disease upon a creature that you can see within range which slowly eats away at its body, and transfers some of that creature's life to you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target is unaffected and the spell ends.

On a failed save, a plague begins to rapidly eat away at the flesh of the target. Once per turn, the plague deals {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage to the target when you hit it with an attack. If the die deals damage below the maximum amount, you also heal yourself for an amount equal to the missing amount on the die.
If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a following turn of yours to attempt to afflict the disease on to a new creature.
{@italic Concentration Points: 2}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the die used for the spell increases in size by one for each slot level above 1st, up to a {@dice d12} at 5th level.

spell.name: Wave of Terror
entries: As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a shroud of darkness covers the area affected by the spell, as wailing voices and faces with expressions of terror accompany the dark magic. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Wisdom saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage and becomes {@condition frightened} of you. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition frightened}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cloak of Flies
entries: As a bonus action, you endow a willing creature with a surrounding magical aura that looks like buzzing flies. The aura extends 5 feet from the target in every direction, but not through total cover. The aura lasts for the duration of the spell, or until the affected target is {@condition incapacitated}. You can dismiss the spell at any time as a bonus action.

The aura grants the target advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks but disadvantage on all other Charisma checks. Any other creature that starts its turn in the aura takes {@damage 2d4} poison damage.
{@italic Concentration Points: 2}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the poison damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Essence Abduction
entries: A cloud of life draining necrotic energy the size of one square emanates from you towards a direction, travelling in a 5 foot wide line up to 30 feet away, striking all creatures in its path.
